dict.acceptation: 仅仅，只不过；小的，轻微的；纯粹的；

sent.orig: He is a mere nobody, and it is mere a matter of time for people to recognize him.
sent.trans: 他只不过是个小人物，要大家认清这一点只是时间问题。

sent.orig: For them these are not mere letters or mere words.
sent.trans: 对他们而言，这些并非纯粹的字母或是单词。

sent.orig: It'seems to be the mere rarity that attracts the average collector.
sent.trans: 而收藏家对一部书的兴趣似乎仅在于它是否罕见。

sent.orig: All the critical twiddle-twaddle about style and form is mere impertinence and mostly dull jargon.
sent.trans: 所有这些有关文体和体裁的蠢话，只是风马牛不相及的胡扯，多半是枯燥无味、玩弄述语的评论。

sent.orig: We wonder why he boiled over at the mere mention of the matter.
sent.trans: 我们不知道为什么他一听到有人提这件事就发怒。
